publications.name: Effective Cloud Removal for Remote Sensing Images by an Improved Mean-Reverting Denoising Model with Elucidated Design Space
publications.publisher: The IEEE/CVF Conference on Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition (CVPR) 2025
publications.summary: This is the first paper published by Yi Liu in CVPR 2025. This paper is about improving diffusion models for cloud removal in remote sensing image processing. This is also the undergraduate thesis of Yi Liu, which is supervised by Associate Professor Wengen Li. This thesis also got the excellent undergraduate thesis award in College of Computer Science and Technology, Tongji University.

references.name: Associate Professor Wengen Li
references.reference: Professor Wengen Li is the supervisor of Yi Liu. He is an associate professor at the College of Computer Science and Technology, Tongji University. His research interests include Multimodal Intelligence and Spatial Temporal Data Analysis.

projects.name: Cloud Removal Based on Generative Models
projects.summary: 1) Conducted systematic analysis of 100+ top-tier conference/journal papers, completing a thorough technical review and bottleneck problem analysis for diffusion models in remote sensing cloud removal tasks. 2) Proposed a novel cloud removal diffusion model with modular framework addressing pixel-level inconsistency, module coupling issues, and mono/multi-temporal compatibility, achieving SOTA performance. 3) First-author paper accepted to appear at CVPR 2025.

projects.name: Compressed Image Reconstruction (Low-Level Vision)
projects.summary: 1) Comprehensively conducted literature review on snapshot compressive imaging (SCI), analyzing 50+ top-tier conference/journal papers (CVPR/ICCV/TPAMI) to deliver a visiting report as a technical summary. 2) Independently investigated efficient architectures (linear attention, state space models), adapting these frameworks into low-level vision pipelines validated on SCI benchmarks, with findings presented at lab meetings.

projects.name: SenseAir: AI-Driven Compressed Air System Management Platform
projects.summary: Developed a digital twin platform integrating deep learning for air compressor maintenance; obtained software copyright and filed patent application (CN202211466896.3) based on our innovation as the first inventor.

projects.name: Remote Human-Machine Co-Driving System
projects.summary: 1) Engaged in an in-depth study of autonomous driving. 2) Present weekly reports on the findings of literature review. 3) Authored and refined a patent application (CN202211466896.3).
